body:
So given the fact that you can use regular qute constructs in the localized message I would recommend to use the [`{#when}`](https://quarkus.io/guides/qute-reference#when_section) section in a message spread out across several lines. Something like:

```java
@Message
String displayName(MyEnum myEnum);
```
and in the localized file: 
```properties
displayName={#when myEnum}\
       {#is ON}On\
       {#is OFF}Off\
       {#else}Undefined\
      {/when}
```
Note that the backslash character must be used to escape a line separator.

One thing we could do is to integrate the type-safe messages with [`@io.quarkus.qute.TemplateEnum`](https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/qute-reference#convenient-annotation-for-enums). I.e. if you annotate your enum with `@TemplateEnum` we could automatically process the localized messages that start with the corresponding namespace:

```properties
MyEnum.ON=On
MyEnum.OFF=Off
MyEnum.UNDEFINED=Undefined
```
and then in the template:
```html
{MyEnum:i18n(myEnumVal)}
```
WDYT?

issue.title: Qute: type-safe messages - add test for localized enum
issue.body:
- related to #40089
- also use the convenient TemplateInstance#setLocale() method

body: @mkouba the first solution is a bit tedious, but @TemplateEnum makes perfect sense thank you !

> @mkouba the first solution is a bit tedious, 

Well, I don't find it tedious. At least, it's perfectly clear what it does ;-).

> but @TemplateEnum makes perfect sense thank you !

I'll try to propose a new pull request.

I was thinking about this and I believe that it would be better if we autogenerate the message template instead.

For example, if a message bundle method consumes _a single enum param_ and the _value is defaulted_:
```java
@Message
String myEnum(MyEnum myEnum);
```
For an enum:
```java
enum MyEnum {  ON, OFF, UNDEFINED }
```
Then we could treat this message bundle method definition as if it was:
```java
@Message("{#when myEnum}"
                + "{#is ON}{msg:org_acme_MyEnum_ON}"
                + "{#is OFF}{msg:org_acme_MyEnum_OFF}"
                + "{#is UNDEFINED}{msg:org_acme_MyEnum_UNDEFINED}"
                + "{/when}")
String myEnum(MyEnum myEnum);
```
And so the localized file could just contain:
```properties
# FQCN with underscores instead of dots
org_acme_MyEnum_ON=On
org_acme_MyEnum_OFF=Off
org_acme_MyEnum_UNDEFINED=Undefined
```
This way we could reuse the existing API and still provide a convenient way of localization for enum constants.

UPDATE: Except that we'll need to add "synthetic" methods for  `{msg:org_acme_MyEnum_ON}` etc. anyway.

@mkouba I think that make sense. 
I am thinking about one detail: I think it would be more usable if we allowed multiple mapping for the same enum.
Use cases for this would be for example providing a short name and an extended name, or more contextualized names depending of where the enum is used.
So maybe we should add the name of the method as a prefix for this to work ?

> I am thinking about one detail: I think it would be more usable if we allowed multiple mapping for the same enum.
> Use cases for this would be for example providing a short name and an extended name, or more contextualized names depending of where the enum is used.

That's a good idea. In theory, we could even skip the enum FQCN part and use the method name instead:
```properties
myEnum_ON=On
myEnum_OFF=Off
myEnum_UNDEFINED=Undefined
```
Of course, we will validate the enum constants and fail the build if appropriate.

issue.title: Qute type-safe messages: add convenient way to localize enum constants
